note: Gender gap data is unadjusted for worker characteristics. Labor force participation figures correspond to [modeled ILO estimates](#dod:ilo-modelled-estimates). Employment is defined in line with the [13th ICLS](#dod:13-icls) and includes the production of goods for own use, such as subsistence farming.
title: Gender wage gap vs. ratio of female-to-male labor force participation
subtitle: The gender wage gap is the difference between average earnings of men and women, expressed as a percentage of average earnings of men. The female-to-male labor force participation ratio compares the share of women and men in the working-age population (ages 15 and over) who are economically active (employed or unemployed).
